newsitem.title: FINLAND: ELEVEN PCT OF STARKJOHANN CHANGES HANDS.
newsitem.headline: ELEVEN PCT OF STARKJOHANN CHANGES HANDS.

text.p: Eleven percent of shares in Finnish hardware and car retailer Starckjohann Oy changed hands on Friday, but the company declined to comment on who the buyer and seller were.

"About 11 percent of the shares and votes have been traded today," said Starckjohann's chief financial officer Vesa Vertanen, but said he had received no official word of who the buyer and seller were and declined further comment.
Vertanen said Starckjohann has about 129 million shares in issue.
At midsession Merita Securities brokered a 12 million share deal in Starckjohnn at a price of 7.00 markka per share, down 0.65 from its Thursday close.
The brokerage declined to comment on the trade and a Merita Bank spokeswoman said the bank had not sold its shares in the company. Merita holds over 50 percent of Starckjohann stock.
Earlier this month, Starckjohann said its full-year 1996 earnings would fall slightly on 1995, but that 1997 earnings would clearly improve on 1996.
In 1995, Starckjohann had a 78.7 million markka profit after financial items.
